Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2011 03:02PM Jen1234 wrote: I have just been diagnosed with bone mets at age 37 with three small kids - my world feels like its collapsing.  I wasn't sure if NED was possible with bone mets???  But after reading Heidi's post do I have hope??  I have had 3 weeks of radiation to the spine and then started Femara (Letrozole) and Zomata.  I may possibly be enrolling in a clinical trial also adding Bevacizumab to my treatment.  Is this normal treatment?  I too so long to raise my kids to adulthood - I have such joy in being a mom!!  Is anyone doing any other homeopathic therapies at home that they swear by?  I am open to anything right now.  Has anyone heard of Issels Treatment Centers?  Can't tell if its hokey or worth investigating.  HELP!
Posts.Title: How long have you had bone mets? Foxlairfrm cmhartley
